channel.title: Cho-Nan Tsai CTO essays and talks
channel.description: Recent content on Cho-Nan Tsai CTO essays and talks

item.title: How to (gracefully) jump start data science initiatives at a start-up
item.description: Slides for IDEAS datascience talk PPTX Slides for IDEAS datascience talk PDF About the Talk While machine learning and artificial intelligence can deliver a ton of value to businesses, there are still many businesses today struggling to get started with data science initiatives. Do you buy data or collect data? What type of talent to hire to get started on the first project? What kind of data tool chain, data infrastructure and data lake make most sense to set up in the beginning?

item.title: A Gentle Introduction to Quantum Computing
item.description: About the Talk Quantum computers could spur the development of new breakthroughs in science, medications to save lives, machine learning methods to diagnose illnesses sooner, materials to make more efficient devices and structures, financial strategies to live well in retirement, and algorithms to quickly direct resources such as ambulances. But what exactly is quantum computing, and what does it take to achieve these quantum breakthroughs? This talk will provide a gentle introduction to those that are interested in this new computing frontier.

item.title: Feedback to Columbia Magazine on the Cyberwarfare article
item.description: I have been reading Columbia Magazine for years but this is the first time I have written a feedback to its editor. It was my reaction to a rather interesting interview with Jason Healy, a senior researcher Scholar at Columbia | SIPA (where I spent many hours studying in its library during my undergrad years). The entire interview is here. My response to the article: Your interview with Jason Healey couldn’t be more timely and spot on.

item.title: How a fintech company ended up next to Skid Row
item.description: A sickly-looking man, walking like a zombie, crossed my path in the middle of the road as I drove through Skid Row to get to office. While waiting for him to pass, I looked to the left and only to find more disturbing scenes: a few homeless people in a tent shooting drugs up their arms and a soup kitchen filled with people whose despair-stricken eyes were staring right back at me.

item.title: A CTO's internship program out of a Los Angeles Startup
item.description: In 1999 while still a sophomore in college, I was given a chance that completely changed the course of my life. I met Kaoru Hayashi, the CEO and co-founder of a Tokyo tech startup called Digital Garage (now a publicly traded company in Japan) and he offered me a 3-month internship at his startup in Tokyo. Till this date, I still cherish every moment of that internship experience - learning how to code for the first time in Python and Zope, being exposed to open source technologies, meeting up with Joi Ito (then an entrepreneur, now a director at MIT Media Lab), supporting a live web coverage at Fuji Rock concert, hanging out with cool Tokyo teenagers and more.

item.title: Lainto Coalition
item.description: At a panel, discussing the importance of cybersecurity for small- and mid-size businesses.

item.title: Big Data Opportunities in the Fintech Space
item.description: About the Talk Big data has impacted fintech in many ways. Some of the most creative applications of big data technology have been in the areas of fraud detection, marketing and credit underwriting for small business loans. This talk looks at some major players and how big data is leading innovations and shaping strategies in the space. About Camino Financial Camino Financial is a credit marketplace matching small businesses with affordable business loans, with interest rates starting at 5.

item.title: A CTO’s Startup Journey in Beijing Zhongguancun Science Park
item.description: After 10+ hours of flight, I finally arrived in Beijing. The invitation was hard to resist. The opportunity to start a new venture in Beijing sounded like an adventure not to be missed. This brought me to Beijing. My other co-founders literally got the keys to our loft that very same day I arrived. I was greeted by my CEO who just dashed in from the hospital as someone in his family had passed away a few hours earlier.
